alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 15 at 2:46AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast, East Central, North Central, and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, especially where drains have become clogged with leaf debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 244 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past 6 to 8 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Bangor, Old Town, Ellsworth, Bucksport, Millinocket, Blue Hill, Howland, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Milo, Veazie, East Millinocket, Dedham, Castine, Medway and Kenduskeag. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
